abstract: After years of conflict, Microsoft and the computing and education project One Laptop Per Child have reached an agreement that will put Windows on the organization’s computers.
snippet: After years of conflict, Microsoft and the computing and education project One Laptop Per Child have reached an agreement that will put Windows on the organization’s computers.
lead_paragraph: After a years-long dispute, Microsoft and the computing and education project One Laptop Per Child said Thursday that they had reached an agreement to offer Windows on the organization’s computers.

headline.main: Microsoft Joins Effort for Laptops for Children
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Shifts Stance and Joins Effort to Provide Low-Cost Laptops to Children

abstract: Yahoo’s chairman rejected accusations from the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn that the company’s board had acted irrationally in rejecting a $47.5 billion takeover offer from Microsoft.
snippet: Yahoo’s chairman rejected accusations from the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn that the company’s board had acted irrationally in rejecting a $47.5 billion takeover offer from Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Yahoo’s chairman, Roy Bostock, rejected late Thursday accusations from the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn that the company’s board had acted irrationally in turning down a $47.5 billion takeover offer from Microsoft and repeated that Yahoo remained open to a deal at the right price.

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Miguel Helft

abstract: Following is the text of a letter sent by the billionaire investor, Carl Icahn, to the chairman of Yahoo, Roy Bostock, on Thursday in which Mr. Icahn announced plans to start a proxy fight for Yahoo.
snippet: Following is the text of a letter sent by the billionaire investor, Carl Icahn, to the chairman of Yahoo, Roy Bostock, on Thursday in which Mr. Icahn announced plans to start a proxy fight for Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: Following is the text of a letter sent by the billionaire investor, Carl Icahn, to the chairman of Yahoo, Roy Bostock, on Thursday in which Mr. Icahn announced plans to start a proxy fight for Yahoo. Included with the letter were the biographies of Mr. Icahn’s 10 nominees for the board. (Later in the day, Yahoo issued a response.)

headline.main: Text of Icahn’s Letter to Yahoo Board
headline.print_headline: Text of Icahn’s Letter to Yahoo Board

abstract: Yahoo‘s chairman, Roy Bostock, rejected late Thursday accusations from the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn that the company’s board had acted irrationally in turning down a $47.5 billion takeover offer from Microsoft and repeated that Yahoo remained open to a deal at the right price.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo‘s chairman, Roy Bostock, rejected late Thursday accusations from the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn that the company’s board had acted irrationally in turning down a $47.5 billion takeover offer from Microsoft and repeated that Yahoo remained open to a deal at the right price.

headline.main: Yahoo Chairman Fires Back at Icahn
